metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21539 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.29 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data as well as unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.0 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-router - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.30-0ubuntu1').
